main event: On May 5, 1968, a bright red flashing light was reported hovering over Wyoming, Ohio for approximately 1.5 hours.
interesting points: The light was observed first at 9:15 PM approaching from the northwest and traveling southeast., It pulsed or flashed at a rate of approximately 2 flashes per second., The witness, Mr. James Snider, described the object as circular, glowing, and about 75-100 feet in diameter., The object made several erratic movements, including sudden accelerations and hovering., Investigators found no corroborating evidence or other witnesses to support the sighting.
sighted object: a bright red flashing light in the sky
witness description: Mr. James Snider, a 36-year-old chemical engineer
